elements.title: Isle of Dogs Pumping Station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Isle of Dogs Pumping Station (pictured) was nicknamed the Temple of Storms?

elements.title: María Pacheco (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that 16th-century chroniclers thought María Pacheco, a leader of the Revolt of the Comuneros, was a witch?

elements.title: fourth season (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that some critics described the fourth season of Last Week Tonight with John Oliver as comic relief from the activities of the Trump administration?

elements.title: Zhou Wennan (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in order to re-marry, Zhou Wennan had to request Mao Zedong's permission?

elements.title: Kirkby Ski Slope (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that schoolchildren in the town of Kirkby were paid 25 pence an hour to help build Kirkby Ski Slope, even though the slope never opened?

elements.title: Lois E. Trott (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Lois E. Trott ran the first lodging house for homeless girls in America, providing shelter and support for over 1,000 girls annually, all without receiving any payment?

elements.title: Jerzy Kosinski: A Biography (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Jerzy Kosinski: A Biography described its subject as a "liar", and yet, one reviewer felt that the author's "studiously neutral position ends up sounding like an apologia for Kosinski"?

elements.title: Chihiro (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that "Chihiro" by Billie Eilish was titled in reference to the main character of Spirited Away?

elements.title: NewJeansNim (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the DJ NewJeansNim has been credited with reviving interest in Buddhism among South Korean youths?
